page.title: 19TEACHERS INDUSTRIAL DISPUTE
page.content: In 1985,a prolonged dispute between teachers,management and the government took place.This was basically about erosion in salaries since the Houghton and Clegg awards of the 1970's and about the governments intention to try to link any pay award to a much greater restriction(or control) of teacher and education. It would be interesting to try to predict the future of teaching but I foresee a growth in the importance of personal and social development with children in schools,and a lessening of the more traditional values of schools such as memorising facts etc.. The dispute currently operating,has curtailed many school activities and led to parents receiving no reports and having no opportunity to consult their child's teacher.A meeting today (11:7:85) is due to make a new offer.
